alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 09 at 11:46AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...The Mosquito Fork at the Taylor Highway. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1030 AM AKDT, a river gauge and trained weather spotters reported an ice jam on the Mosquito Fork at the Taylor Highway. Impounding water due to the ice jam is causing rapid river rises upstream. - Ice on the Mosquito Fork has risen up to the level of the bottom of the bridge. Water is reported flooding over bank along the Mosquito Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Mosquito Fork, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
